graph

Class AdjacencyGraph<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • graph.AdjacencyGraph<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Graph<T>

    public class AdjacencyGraph<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Graph<T>
    An implementation of graphs using adjacency lists
    Version:
    November 2019
    Author:
    Hugh Osborne

        Remove a node, and all edges leading to and from it, from the graph.
        Specified by:
        remove in interface Graph<T>
        Parameters:
        node - the node to be removed - all edges leaving the node, and all edges entering the node will also be deleted.

        Specified by:
        add in interface Graph<T>
        Parameters:
        start - the start node of the edge to be added.
        end - the end node of the edge to be added.
        Throws:
        GraphError - if the edge already exists, or if either start or end is not a node in the graph
